Reviews.Title: “surprise!surprise!”
Reviews.Author: chenelyn c
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to HK was booked through Best Buy Travel in the Phils and handled by Holiday World Tours HK. GuangDong Hotel is not in the main road but still conveniently located. When you get past the "cold" and impersonal front office, you realize the hotel is quite nice. We requested for a triple shared room which turned out to be very comfortable. Of course the walls needed some touch ups and the flush sounded like a plane at take-off but all in all we were very happy with the accomodations. With a little more customer service training and a few repairs, this hotel would be my choice everytime I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Sugarhitz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a street full of bars and restaurants. The room was decent size compared to other HK hotel I've stayed before. It is an old hotel but maintained well. I got a very good deal when I booked it. I think I paid around AUD100/night for the deluxe room. From this hotel you can get to anywhere in TST by walking. MTR is not far too. There is a very popular dessert cafe nearby. The room was neat and bathroom was clean. I will go back for the same rate but not any higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but with old equipment”
Reviews.Author: indrakm
Reviews.Content: Over all the hotel is good. It locates in very great location. Close to strait where avenue of the star is, close to MTR station, close to ferry terminal, close to Nathan road, and close to Kowloon park. The staffs were also helpful. The room is small, but this is Hong Kong, so it was acceptable. If only the electronic equipment especially the TV set had been new and Wifi could had been free, the experience would had been flawless. Because this hotel still has old CRT TV and the Wifi connection is too expensive. If you want to go to china ferry terminal, take a nice walk through the Kowloon park, cross the sky bridge directly to ferry terminal building. It would only take you about 10-15 minutes and you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: chirag1978
Reviews.Content: good location..centre of tsim sha tsui...decent service..goods for busienss travellers but too compact for family travellers...rooms are neat & clean but too small..no place to even keep your luggage..wardrobe is like a small closed wih 3 hangers..pls prefer higher floors since on weekends its too noisy because of pub & surrondings. Has Macdonald bang opposite & various other options for food.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: This is a clean remodeled hotel a little above average honestly, but great value for the price. Located in a busy street with plenty of food, drink & otherwise options, but still feels very safe and is relatively quiet at night. Rooms look very clean and well kept, as well as the staff being very helpful. My only suggestion is to give walking directions from the MTR station since I was a little lost for a while (At least suggest the closest exit!). There is a surcharge for the internet use like most places in HK, but they should at least offer a courtesy computer for guests to check emails, they do have a business center but also has a usage charge. Don't think I would return other than for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, worn and average, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Extensive-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and 3 min walk to TST Station. Room was clean, basic, good air con, carpet etc little worn but for 3 nights adequate as I wasn't planning on spending too much time in my room. Staff were very helpful, no complaints. Despite being worn I would not be put off staying here again if on hol or short break (rooms are not really for the business traveller, internet is charged). Rooms a little on the small size, no pool as advertised (be aware) but location is fab and very central. McDonalds across the road (good cheap breakfast). Would stay here because... Plenty of good restruarants, seven 11, street food and bars etc within seconds as you step out of the hotel. Suggest a visit to Knutsford Terrace around 7:30pm, which is less than 5 min stroll away (out of hotel, right and keep going up hill to Kimberly Rd and straight up the steep service road next to the steps(which is alternative route). Knutsford T is a great little spot with really good restarants (Indian, Thai, Chineese etc) and nightlife - do not miss Knutsford T. Watch out for Taxi drivers hiking up the price to travel to honk kong island or returning, tunnel fee normally only $15-20. Some taxis like to try and overcharge -One manually added charges to the final journey fare on the meter at the end of our journey. Refuse to pay if you dont agree, ask hotel staff. The metro is easy to use, cheap. Top tip - if your visiting The Peak, take the no 15 bus outside the Star ferry terminal 4 or 5 at Central Station (Hong Kong Island). Its cheaper, less crowded and far more scenic than Peak Tram (which is normaly crowded. Also, exchange rate inside markets better by 10% (no commission) than airport or on road kiosks.

Reviews.Title: “all good except for the bed”
Reviews.Author: Thomas S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fairly modern, room a good size for solo male guest. Smoking room was a plus. only problem was the bed. It was rock solid, every time I went to lay on it it felt like I was on a slab of concrete. Staff were a pleasure, very helpful in organising my ferry ride to Macau. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PlacesAndFood
Reviews.Content: First time traveling to Hong Kong and my friend booked this hotel. Why do call this party hotel as the street is fulled with bars, pubs and discos. It wasn't noisy at all but it was definitely a fun place to stay for party goers. You can read my full review http://www.placesandfoods.com/2011/04/guang-dong-hotel-review-hong-kong.html

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: fnms99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for HK Sevens and ideally located for the games and for everything else that goes with them!!! Can't say say anymore as "what goes on tour...stays on tour!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Jon_from_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a quick trip in HK. Its pretty close (around 3 blocks) from the sub-way and about a 15 minute walk from the harbour and temple street night market. Some really good street food across the street as well. Not quite the 4 star experience but I would go back again.,

Reviews.Title: “A great base”
Reviews.Author: JohnSpence73
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the cheapest, and they are able to do this by cutting some corners. The carpets and bathroom is a little "tired" but otherwise it was perfectly good enough. The location is great, it's right in the middle of a little hub of nightlife, really close to public transport, and shopping. Really easy to get to and from the airport by using Cityflyer bus A21, less than £3 each way..!!

Reviews.Title: “location is good, clean beds but otherwise little else”
Reviews.Author: chrisfromcanberra
Reviews.Content: Prat Street is a great location in Tsim Sha Tsui and this hotel was opposite Butterfly on Prat hotel. Butterfly would have blown our budget so we opted for what we thought was a deluxe room for 3 single women - a queen and 2 singles. We got a so-called deluxe which was very small, with a rollaway bed at the end of 2 single beds. no room to swing a cat. We complained and showed our hotel.com booking sheet. Apparently it meant EITHER a queen or 2 singles. After a lot of firm protest and no movement from the hotel i asked what they could do for us. They offered us a standard triple room - but no price reduction. Frankly, the size of the standard was bigger than the deluxe, and there wre no other differences in standard. The bathroom floor was covered in dust and hair and obviously had not been mopped for a while. our request for this to be cleaned resulted in a man picking up the hair in a tissue and leaving the rest! As an apology they said they would bring us a 'fruit platter' - we were rethinking our opinion of the place until presented with 1 pear, an apple and a banana, unpeeled. Not really a platter! The rooms are very musty and on the 3rd floor we looked over concrete. All in all, it felt backpacker standard, at an inflated price. I wish we had stayed at the YMCA down by the water, for very little extra, or paid for a nicer room in a cheaper district like mongkok. Given the excellent and cheap MTR, other districts with a better standard of accommodation would have suited me better. In summary, I wouldn't recommend this place. If I go basic, as a trade-off I want cheap. This was bad standard in a good location but too costly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jonas L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and son for just a night. The hotel has changed a lot since the last time I saw it about 20 years ago (used to stay at nearby Park hotel on Chatham with my family and would pass by this hotel). I booked the room through their website and requested for a queen sized bed, which unfortunately was not available when we checked in. We were given a room on the 16th floor with 2 single beds. As expected, the room was not big, so there was just enough room to move around. The room and bath room were clean - wife and kid were both allergic to dust and had asthma and they did not have any problems with the room which was good - I was very much concerned with the comments with regards to cleanliness and unpleasant odors, so luckily we did not experience any of such. The beds were not too hard, we actually had no trouble getting to sleep - we went back to hotel around 5:30 pm after a day of walking, just to rest and then go out for dinner - we ended up sleeping soundly until the morning, missing dinner. The hotel is in a great location, very near to the MTR and only a short walk to the Star ferry terminal and a lot of tourist spots on the TST district. The area also has a lot of places to shop and dine - local diners around the hotel (there's a McDonalds across the hotel, just in case), and 24 hour convenience shops (7-11 and International) just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel let down by insufficient care in cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Nzkop
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good location with friendly helpful staff. Beds were clean and reasonably comfortable. Room was spacious (for HK), however the floor had not been vacuumed properly (or at all) which was a shame as all else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: dumpling4
Reviews.Content: 7days 6nights at this hotel. Convenience and good location. Helpful frontdesk staff. 5mins walk away from MTR station. No free Wifi. Charging HKD30 for an hour internet connection. Shock by the ridiculously expensive charge. Walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Few steps away from McD and convenience stores. Very noisy at night as lots of club and bars across the street. And you can hear people talking loudly in Mandarin almost every night (very annoying).

Reviews.Title: “Oh man!”
Reviews.Author: JuSaLisFiaYah
Reviews.Content: Was there for 4 nights and service was terrible. Staff at the front desk was unfriendly. No smiles. The only friendly staff there was d housekeeping lady. If not for the location, i would've stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Go there with low expectations and you won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: TrueToForm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comparable to a motel by western standards, and average by Chinese standards. The hotel is located on a very busy small street, however I wasn't bothered by the noise in my room(7th floor). There's many restaurants so I would pass on the hotel food since almost all restaurants in hk are English friendly. The rooms there are old. The hotel has more smoking floors than nonsmoking ones, so nonsmoking rooms are very limited. The staff was so-so. They were courteous, but not informative. Asides from what was on the same street and the location of the subway, they couldn't give any good information on my other inquiries such as: 1. Where can I get a sim card? I found like 6 phone stores in a 2 block radius of the hotel. 2. I forgot my laptop cord so I asked them if they knew where I could get one. Nobody had a clue. I checked online and I found an area of hk where it's common knowledge to sell electronics stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough...convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GieroGirl
Reviews.Content: The best thing in this hotel is its location. There were lots of bars & restaurants surrounding the hotel which I don't remember being there last I was there in '08 (I actually remember the street to be chaotic). Lobby looks & smells nice...if only the reception people were as nice & friendly - it would have been perfect. At 330pm, room is still not ready so we were made to wait - they need to replace their sofa set, they're old. We stayed in a (really small) Executive room on the 16th floor so no problem about noise. As for the view, forget it - there's none. Also, I found the bed too hard but my Mom thought it was just right. notwithstanding the obviously old carpet, the room was seems clean. There's complimentary bottled water too. Breakfast buffet costs HK$88++ /person. Just right but nothing special. Considering that we only stayed overnight, I think it was not so bad. We were out most of the time anyway. Getting a cab is not a problem. MTR is near. Shopping and dining areas are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “better stay away”
Reviews.Author: Holger B
Reviews.Content: On my trip to through Asia it was the most expensive and the worst hotel I had. The welcome was a cold one by a young clerk, who wanted a 1000 HKD extra as a deposit (in addition to the payment of the room rate). But the worst disappointment was the room itself, which was an old and very worn one and which was not clean. In the bath there were hairs from my predecessor everywhere. The adequate price for it would have been at half the rate I paid (ca 120 EUR).

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NicoB1981
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 4 days in Guang Dong Hotel in Tsimshatsui and its the best stay I had in Hong Kong for a reasonable budget. Its not the cheapest, and they somewhat rip you off for internet but compared with previous stays in Hong Kong that werent actually that much cheaper, I got a nice, clean room with all the regular facilities. Nothing out of the ordinary but nothing missing either. Location is also great - easy to be reached by car/taxi as well as less than 5 minutes walk to the MTR. Will stay there again next time I'll be in Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back..”
Reviews.Author: DrFlo77
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, we took Citybus A21 from airport and stop at #16, and it was a walking distance from there. As I arrived at the hotel around 1300 hrs, the counter was full of Chinese Mainland tourist, the talked loudly and quite selfish. Never follow the que. Anyway, the front officer was quite efficient, and speak English well . Took around 30 minutes and we had our room cards. Our room at the 16th floor ( non smoking- executive room). Entered the room, it was quite good , I had a good first impression, though it’s small. The room is well arranged. Double bed ( not big). Bar fridge, self coffee making corner and boiler. Wardrobe, sandals, robes, umbrella. 32 inches plasma tv.Interesting Tv channels ( Discovery, national geography and sports, NHK Japan) Bathroom is reasonably good, with bath tub and big mirror. Toiletries provided ie, comb, toothbrushes, shampoos and bath gel. The room cleaner clean our room on time, and supplies generously with the toiletries . Towels are chnaged daily. Big wide window from our room, but the view are lousy! I can say no view, you need it for sun light only. All I can see from the window is a back side of an hotel or apartment. 2nd night at the hotel, Ifound the hotel bed was hard. My friend had good night sleep because she took Piriton, but i easily wake up. The hotel front desk are quite helpful, we asked for complimentary HK map from here and asked few times about road direction. For location I think this is one of the best located in TST. The TST MTR is around 10 minutes walk. Overall the hotel I can say 4 out of 5!

Reviews.Title: “ONLY FOR LOCATION....GREAT NIGHTLIFE AROUND !!”
Reviews.Author: MANISH_AGRA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family...and took a triple room. Initial experience as you enter the lobby is great and you tend to get impressed. Its only when you get to the rooms that you realize that its quite an average hotel. The rooms were really small, clean and the triple room we got was so packed that we didn't find place to keep our suitcases. I had really thought that the triple room will be bigger. The location is the key to this hotel.....nathan road is only 5 min walk.....the best of the night life is around the hotel.....we found all the fancy cars and amazing crowd doing rounds around our hotel. There were some really nice bars and pubs around the hotel......besides this the hotel is quite avarage.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive With a Comfortable Bed.”
Reviews.Author: Ironclad35
Reviews.Content: I have been in and out of Hong Kong for the past three or four years, on business or resting during transit. In that time, I have stayed at a number of very good to excellent hotels in Tsim Sha Tsui (East). These hotels have two things in common: they are expensive and they are luxurious. I had to make some last minute reservations for the second week in August for my return to Asia from a visit back home. I decided to save a few dollars by booking the Guangdong Hotel, reputed to be a "four star hotel" located in the heart of East Tsim Sha Tsui. Without looking at reviews, I booked, just thankful to have a place to stay while in Hong Kong and resting before heading back to Shenzhen, and then to Macau. I must say that I am a little disappointed. The hotel is three star at best, too expensive, with a small room and small bathroom but a very comfortable bed. The lobby is clean, open and effecient. The check in process was smooth and easy. I was helped to the room by a good hop who earned his tip. Opening the door, I was struck by the small room. It's big enough for one, but is a little crowded at that. The only good thing, in honesty, is the bed. It is a non-smoking room, and had wireless internet for a fee, a big Sharp TV, small business desk, small chest of drawers, a micro-closet, and very crowded bathroom. It is clean, however. This hotel appears to be an older hotel, and is likely in need of an upgrade or refurbishing. The walls are a bit thin, and a couple was fighting in the room next to me last night, keeping me awake. I could hear every word (one was American). I wish I had booked either the Nikko or Intercontinental, or Regal Kowloon for that matter, all of which I have had good experiences with before. I shall not book the Guangdong Hotel in the future, and it gets only an average rating due to the bed, location and cleanliness. It loses on modernity, price and clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, I love it! will come back”
Reviews.Author: raquellenez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the good location, with very clean room and good price. It's near to the MTR and K1 shopping centre. Also near to other shopping centre area. I stayed 6 days in Hongkong. Someday if I come to Hongkong again I will choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: ivaramme
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for its price. Excellent location, good service and very decent rooms. Just a couple of issues: reserved a non-smoking room but it actually smelled like if someone was smoking inside before we came in. My guess is that the room wasn't a non-smoking room until a few months ago. The beds were small but bearable, but if you are big person you might have issues. Overall nice place, good value for the money and excellent location. Good things to note: Walking distance from the MTR station, walking distance from the ferry to cross to HK Island, walking distance from Nathan Road, you get it.. very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent room and price”
Reviews.Author: JPYeo
Reviews.Content: Location wise: hotel is located within TST, near to MTR station, plenty of restaurants and cafes nearby offering local fares, western food, snacks and desserts. 7-11, McD and a local supermarket on same street. A night, pubs along the street will come alive, providing continuos traffic into the area. Room wise: decent size, tidy but not spick span clean. For the price we paid, it was acceptable. The bed was extremely hard and I would think this is the hardest bed I have ever slept on a 3-4 star hotel. But luckily when you are dead tired from all the walking and shopping, sleep comes quite easily. We had a room facing the back (not along the street) and it was actually quiet at night. We can't hear anything from the night activities oor the traffic below, so that helped to give us some peace and quiet from the buzzling city. Reception wise: Concierge was harrassed from volumes of luggage to take care of but otherwise was helpful. Front desk was aloof although they were wearing badges that asked them to smile. Conclusion: decent price hotel located at a very convenient place with easy access to food, transport and shopping. Not frill with limited service and a hard bed.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Yanyat08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 9-13 jun 11 for 4 nites. Its abt 5 mins walk to TST station. Opposite e hotel there was a halal indian restaurant which we patronize almost every day. Bustling place, safe for family travel.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: hikenyang
Reviews.Content: I came to Hongkong for shopping. I left some bags in the room and one bag unopened. While when I was back I found that a new clothes was lost aside in the room. When I called back to the hotel manager in the same day checked out, I was told that there was no bag in the room. It's unbelievable! Location is good, but the serive was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “ultimate value for money alongside comfort”
Reviews.Author: aanujj
Reviews.Content: One may never expect to land up with such a great budget for a hotel room in Tsimshatsui, Hong Kong, but for Guangdong it is a real value for money. The hotel is located in the busy streets of Tsimshatsui and is priced just about right for people llike me who did not want to spend much on sleeping but still would have a comfortable bed with some good room service once I'm back after a tiring day. The hotel is simple, the decor is modern, the toilets are clean, room service is quick and staff courteous. The hotel is located just within the market area, so everything is at an arm's length. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but who needs it anyway, specially when there is so much choice available right outside the door. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is tight on budget but still needs a decent space to live.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, decent rooms for a good price in the heart of TST”
Reviews.Author: ManilaRaf
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here in mid-April having booked online through the hotel's website. The rate we paid by booking online (Superior Room) was much cheaper than nearly all the hotels in TST and was cheaper than the rate I received when I inquired via email. We arrived at the hotel at 11am, having arrived at HKIA on a morning flight. We were told that check-in was at 2pm but we were able to do all the check-in paperwork and left our bags at the very helpful concierge desk and were able to do some sightseeing around TST before coming back and promptly receiving the keycard to our room. The room was decent sized. Having read reviews of various hotels in TST on TripAdvisor I was prepared for the worst, but I was satisfied. The room was clean, tidy, and very fresh. The decor and fittings seem dated though. It seemed like a decent mid-leve hotel room. I wasn't going to complain since all we were going to do in the room was sleep and rest, since we'd spend every other available hour exploring Hong Kong. We didn't eat at any of the hotel restaurants because we wanted to explore al Hong Kong had to offer. The hotel is very well situated, only a 5 minute walk from the nearest MTR entrance as well as a brisk 10-15 minute walk to Victoria Harbour, Star Ferry and various TST destinations. The tour desk was very helpful in arranging reservations for guided tours and for our airport transfer on departure the concierge was helpful as well. We were able to store our bags with them between our 12 Noon check-out time and our 3pm coach ride to the airport. It's not the most luxurious or newest hotel in TST, but it's relatively cheap and well situated. My only real complaint was that the hotel WiFi, while not free, is very expensively priced. I suggest travelers either come bringing their own 3G modem and buying a prepaid SIM or heading down the street to the pizza place that offers free WiFi. Overall, it was a decent place. We'd definitely recommend this as a place to stay and we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but convenient”
Reviews.Author: ashutosh1967
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Guangdong Hotel in HK on 25th and 26th March 2011. It was expensive - but then HK hotels are that way. The rooms were small with limited amenities but clean. The lobby was smallish with limited seating for guests. The location was a big plus as its near MTR (just 5 min walk from Tsim Tsa Tsui station and all markets nearby. There is an Indian resturant just a few minutes walk away. The over all stay was confortable but just.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: nemiko
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and I felt this hotel is suitable for alone traveler or students traveler. The people at the reception were nice and kind, room was tidy and clean. In addition, this hotel is really close to tube station, Nathan Road, big shopping malls.... and so on. Just 2 or 3 minutes walk to the station. I would like to stay this hotel if I have a chance to go to Hong Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in the heart of TST”
Reviews.Author: USALove2Travel
Reviews.Content: GH is located in the heart of TST, a 5 min walk to the TST metro station, a 20 min walk to the ferry, a 15 min to the waterfront. GH is an excellent place from which to explore Hong Kong for a reasonable price. Checkin was smooth, with the front desk and bell staff being very helpful. After reading lots of reviews that say Hong Kong rooms are tiny, we were surprised that our room at GH was quite spacious and had a large bed (although it was a "queen" made up of two smaller beds placed together). Breakfast wasn't included, but we did find a small bakery nearby that had lots of different types of pastries and hot tea/coffee to-go (no seating). There are a few interesting little bars next to and across the street from GH. One night, we had drinks and some fun entertainment at the trendy M1 bar (right across from GH), which was full of young Hong Kong residents out to have fun, but quite well behaved.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe it was great back in 1997, but not anymore.”
Reviews.Author: deltaalpha
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at this hotel upon the advice of our dad, who stayed here back in 1997. The other hotel I wanted to stay in was booked up, so we ended up reserving a room at Guangdong. Now, at first glance, the place is magnificent. It's no Hyatt, if you know what I mean, but the lobby is quite impressive and spacious. But it ends there. The reception manager, Flo i think her name was, was quite unaccommodating unlike the other attendants, Pat and Catherine. Those two had a great attitude. Although I must complain that we got there at 1PM, and Flo said the room would be ready at 2, so we waited. At 2, they said the room wasn't ready yet. Long story short they gave us our room keys at 3PM. 3PM!!! I am not pleased but I figure, if the room is okay then I'll let it pass. IT. WAS. NOT. They put me on a smoking floor even after I told them I have asthma. We were given a room with twin beds, a dingy carpet and a moldy bathroom. It was appalling! There were molds on the ceiling area on top of the door, and the fixtures were obviously outdated. There was a contraption on the wall that was apparently a blow dryer (possibly made in the 70s). When you're in the tub you can see the seemingly unfinished construction underneath the sink, which is quite off-putting really. The carpet was hideous. More importantly, after i asked them if I could switch to a non-smoking floor, they told me they'd put me on the waiting list---and then never got back to me! The cleaning lady was polite, but not everyone working there was, so perhaps they should work on that. It was raining on our first two days, so we asked the hotel if we could borrow some umbrellas. We asked for two as there are two of us, but they said only one umbrella per room, which was inconvenient. Needless to say, we will not be going back to this hotel and we do not recommend this to travelers as there are better and more reasonably-priced hotels than Guangdong. Will just stick to the one across the street from it.

Reviews.Title: “I Highly recommend this hotel, its convenient and its a nice place”
Reviews.Author: tiffani081883
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom last July for the Hong Kong sale. It is very convenient because it is a 5 minute walk from the Subway station, 3 minutes walk from the airport shuttle and very well situated in TST area.

Reviews.Title: “Guangdong Hotel Ideally Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug10001
Reviews.Content: Located in heart of the Tsimshatsui, Kowloon the main attraction is the location. It close to the MTR, shopping malls and markets and places to eat. The rooms however are very small even by Hong Kong standards. The staff were not that friendly, however spoke good english. The rooms were clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “nice location.. extra small bed”
Reviews.Author: sanChd
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very nice location.Just a few steps away from the famous nathan road. Some nice pubs and shopping places are just in the vicinity,but if you are more than 5feet 7 inches tall, do not prefer this hotel. Your feet will surely hang out of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “If one needs to meet sour faced staff, this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Isha1963
Reviews.Content: I was in Hong Kong last week, and stayed at the Guang Dong in Kowloon. I have never met such sour faced staff before; the ones serving breakfast are among the worst. The rooms are not good, too. As others have said, it is indeed overpriced and over rated.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DTYL
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Hong Kong recently due to the closure of UK airspace as a consequence of the volcanic ash from Iceland. We paid just over £100 per room per night. I'm afraid to say that we have stayed at much better hotels for less than this. The hotel still allows smoking in some of its rooms, which I find hugely disappointing in this modern era. The lobby looks reasonably clean and tidy. However, the rooms themselves were a real let down. The rooms were small and the carpets in them were immensely dirty. Avoid this hotel if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Guangdong hotel bad service”
Reviews.Author: SGINDO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from 23 Mar to 26 Mar 2010. The staff is impolite and not friendly at all. The location of this hotel is near bar. At night, it is very crowded. All prostitutes standing outside at night start from 10pm. The bed sheet got stain of coffees at first day i stayed. My room number is 603 (Smoking Area), I request for non-smoking area but it is fully booked. The advantages of staying this hotel are located near Tsim Sham Tsui MTR. Secondly, near ferry terminal to macau which is located at Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, small rooms, busy location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights because of its location and low prices. We were able to get rooms for about $100 while many hotels were sold out or at $140++ a night. This hotel was not half as bad as the reviews say. No, it did not "smell of urine" as indicated by one of the previous reviews. I thought that it was pretty clean. The lobby was large and had a few couches for waiting. We tried to check in early at noon and the rooms were not available, but the staff let us stow our luggage and go out to explore the city while we waited for the rooms to be ready. Eventually they were ready by 1pm, and we were allowed to check in early and were upgraded to an executive non-smoking room. The hotel was implementing a "smile campaign" and all of the staff was extremely helpful. They brought up our checked luggage to the room after we checked in. I did find the english of the registration staff a little bit difficult to understand. The hotel is located in on a busy area, about a 5 min. walk from the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. It was initially a bit hard to find and the area has a lot of busy traffic (more so than at BP International). It is within walking distance to Nathan Road, Harbor City, Kowloon Park and also an extended walk to Avenue of the Stars and the Star Ferry. The night markets are relatively easy to access via MTR which is just a few stops away. There are a lot of restaurants nearby. The location is pretty good but you have to be someone who is ok with crossing traffic to get to the MTR. If you are using the CityBus to get to this hotel, you are dropped off on Nathan Road just south of the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR stop. We had two rooms. One was double twins and the other was a queen sized bed (corner room). The room with the queen sized bed was smaller than the one with two twins. I would suggest trying to get a room with two twins as they pushed them together anyway and it was a larger room. Room amenities included water boiling carafe, combs, shampoo, refrigerator, hotel slippers. There was a very small LCD TV awkwardly mounted on the wall. Bathroom was adequate size, but had a strange european style hair dryer on the wall and the toilets were not as new. The bathroom had a slight musty smell. We were on the 11th floor and the view was of the back of another building. If you are a tall person, you may not like staying here. I am 5 ft. 5 inches and could touch the ceiling in the bathroom if I extended my arms. The hallways also had low ceilings (I think possibly 7 ft.). I did not use either restaurant or the internet, so have no feedback on that. Overall, I would say that this is an average type of hotel. No frills, but certainly not a bad place to stay. If a view and luxuries are important to you, then this is not a place that you may want to stay, however, if you intend to be out and about most of the time, it is a good place to stay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that smells of Urine”
Reviews.Author: rg0205
Reviews.Content: It was a short notice trip so I decided to book a hotel room in Guangdong Hotel for myself, my wife and her 23 year old niece. I am from Hong Kong but given that I have a small apartment shared with family members, I thought a hotel room would be more suitable and comfortable for them. So, since their stay was for 8 consecutive nights, I decided to book a room at the Guangdong Hotel because of the convenience of the location which is just in Tsim Sha Tsui. I tried the Imperial Hotel, which was first on the preferential list but they did not have rooms that could be booked for 8 consecutive nights. The Ramada Hotel didnt have consecutive nights stay either and were charging exorbitantly on weekend stays. We ended up at the Guangdong Hotel - UNFORTUNATELY. We stayed in room 711. Check in wasn't difficult. It was swift and easy but the staff weren't exactly warm and friendly. No one helped with our baggage. Then, when we went inside the lift, we all noticed the foul smell of urine. Ironically, it wasn't just ONE lift. For some reason, ALL lifts had a foul smelling odor. Our room was a twin room suite and it was small. When we got in the room, it was dusty. Clearly, the carpet hadnt been vacuumed. I thought, okay, so this is a 3 star hotel. What do you expect? but then, I noticed a blood stain on the pillow, the curtains were FILTHY and had stains all over them. The closet had NO hangers. Not even a single one. And the worse thing was, the bathroom smelled like URINE. I thought maybe just flush the toilet and the smell would go away. It didn't. I went downstairs to complain at the front desk. After flushing the toilet, the water kept running and wouldn't stop so that was a problem, too. We were on our way out, so I had them clean the room and I specifically asked for the beds to be made and for the room to be cleaned. I also asked for clothes hangers. When we returned, there werent any clothes hangers although the bathroom smelled better. The beds were made. However, the fresh scent of the bathroom only lasted for a while. I think housekeeping only sprayed the bathroom with air freshener but did not clean it. It only took at least an hour before the smell of urine was back and none of us had even used the bathroom yet. It was late and we were all tired, so we decided to let it slide and do something about it in the morning. Again, I went to the front desk to complain. We went out for the afternoon. When we arrived after dinner, we still had NO hangers. The bed linens were NOT changed, even if i had specifically requested them to change it. I noticed hair stuck under the sheets since the beddings were white. I was furious. I ran down to the reception area and complained. I said: "We aren't staying here for just a night. It's 8 consecutive nights and youre treating us like garbage." A young gentlemen said he would take care of the matter and I went back to our disgusting room. Shortly after, the manager called. He extended his apologies and offered to upgrade us to an executive suite on the 13th floor - on the next day. He also offered to send us some hangers. The housekeeping staff arrived to deliver them BUT he had asked to check the closet first. So, what in the hell was that? Assurance that I wasnt lying? The upgraded room we were sent to was room 1310. It was cleaner than 711 but small. This time we had hangers BUT we didnt have any slippers. The beddings appeared to be clean. There werent any foul smelling odors. However, a few nights into our stay, my wife and I had bed bug bites on our limbs. To say the least, this hotel stay was absolutely horrid and i would never, for the life of me recommend this to anyone. If you're looking for a budget stay in Tsim Sha Tsui, go for Imperial Hotel if you can because the rooms are slightly bigger and they are newly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For shoppers & Party Animals”
Reviews.Author: MANISH_AGRA
Reviews.Content: On our way back from Bali we took a short break in Hong Kong for 2 days for shopping and getting a glimpse of this mega city with my family. We were told to stay close to Nathan Street if we want to shop and Hotel Guangdong was suggested to us by our travel agent. To start with, the lobby was impressive for a hotel from which we had not expected much. As I was travelling with my 5 year old daughter, they gave us a room with three seperate beds. The rooms were small as is expected from HKG but clean. The bathrooms were clean, but was big enough for one person only. There was always this smell coming from the bathroom in short intervals that was annoying and uncomfortable. Other then that, breakfast was good, and the hotel seems to be a popular business class budget hotel. The best part about the hotel was its location. There were amazing pubs, night clubs right in front of our hotel which seem to be quite popular with local people. This area also seems to be the night hole for party animals as we found a lot of young people driving around in their Ferrari & Porche's late evening. For shoppers in HKG, Nathan Street is the best place and it was only 5 min walk from the hotel. There were quite a few 7-11/ N stores near the hotel for daily needs which was great. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you are in HKG for a short while and would like to make the most of this time !!!

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating and Nice”
Reviews.Author: hello888
Reviews.Content: the room was okay though it was kinda small (you don't need a big room since you're always out) accommodating and nice people. The hotel is close to the MTR station and other shopping places.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Westy014
Reviews.Content: Would agree with some of the other comments viz. good location, hard beds, small room, entrance down a sidestreet. We were there on New Year's eve and the was a noisy nightclub on the opposite side of the street. The bathroom was in need of an upgrade and was the worst of those experienced during our visit to HK, Oz and NZ. Went for the 'Continental Breakfast' in the restaurant and after having 3 pieces of toast I was told in no uncertain terms by a rather brusque lady that we were only allowed 2 pieces per person!! Stayed for 2 nights with 3 people in the room and were very cramped but had expected this. 10/15 min. walk to the Star Ferry pier.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: suruchisethia
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in an excellent location.rooms were small but then hong kong hotels have small rooms.there are lots of indian as well as other restaurants nearby.7/11 and tube(mtr) are practically next door.a very good location to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “be careful of standard room in the corner”
Reviews.Author: jjspore
Reviews.Content: I have a love-hate relationship with hongkong. The night life is very vibrant and i love it... you get a beautiful range of local to high end food/products. But I dont envy the real estate there. The 5 star hotels are not overly fantastic for the price, and when you go to the 3 star hotels, I get rather disappointed. I reached late in HK, and we were given a standard room - 317. Its super crappy. its a corner room which i noticed is smaller than the other standard rooms. the windows were blocked, and u can tell that this was an after-thot room (we suspect it was a worker's store room or maid room) and they turned it into a bedroom to make more cash. I think all the corner rooms numbered x17 have the same layout & they use 2 single size beds instead of a proper double bed. I felt like i was in prison with 4 walls with creaking furniture. We requested for the deluxe room the next nite, and it was a lot more decent. They gave more things in the bathroom, the shower works, there was no noise from the vent, the air ventilation works well, and even tho it was 50sq foot bigger, it was better lit, thus making you feel less crappy. There is a few new hotels popping up. one of them, directly facing this hotel. I think its called butterfly @ prat and it looks really good. just pray you dont get the corner room...

Reviews.Title: “Not again, I am afraid”
Reviews.Author: PRFitz
Reviews.Content: The location is good and things like small room, hard beds - well, you gets what you gets for this price. No complaint there, but a coffee sachet would not hurt. However, I would expect that a hotel at this level would be able to supply business people with an iron and an ironing board. I called and called and called and the staff said that the iron/s were out (in the evening and in the morning). I found the attitude really annoying - "well, I am sorry, there is nothing we can do". And then hanging up. They also admitted that they had this problem all the time (well, buy some MORE, for pete's sake). I have never heard that in a Hong Kong hotel before. I thought I was back in London! I think the whole attitude bothered me more than having to wait for the local shops to open to buy a shirt that looked pressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: BillyandNic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right near Nathan and Canton Rds which are the main shopping areas of HK. It's also right beside an area full of restaurants and bars, not far from the ferry or the Airoport Express train terminal etc. The hotel itself is pretty ok, the staff is friendly enough without being fantastic. The shower etc was fine, the amenities ok, internet charges a little high and bed a little hard, but overall pretty good value for money and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CocoBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This is not one of the best hotels I've stayed in but for the price and location it is definitely good enough! Liked: 3 single beds Convenience LOCATION!! (1 minute walk to MTR station entrance) Close to all the shops (7-Eleven literally nxt door) Walking distance to every tourist attraction in Kowloon (providing you're a walker and don't mind taking in the views and sights along your walks. We walked all the way up to Prince Edward, Ladies Market and Argyle Centre and didn't even know we'd gone that far! Took about 20 mins but you don't need to since the MTR is so close) Disliked: Extremely HARD 3 single beds Overall, I would definitely stay in this hotel again only because of it's LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! I loved having the MTR so close. Otherwise, the bathroom is so-so - (in need of a renovation). The rooms were nice and clean though. The free breakfast wasn't too crash hot but it was edible. (there's a DeliFrance 3 doors down). The staff weren't rude or overtly courteous and friendly - I guess I would say they're just Hong Kongkers. Compared to other places I've stayed before in Asia were the staff would ALWAYS greet you regardless of who they were and what they were doing, I've found that people in Hong Kong generally just left you alone. If you can put up with the above, then this hotel would be ok for you too!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Asian_Nomad
Reviews.Content: We are never going back to GDH! We asked for directions from the Concierge three times (to Hilton Tower, to Elements Mall and to HMV Video outlet) and three times we were given WRONG directions! We asked for (water) dipper because the comfort room did not have a bidet, we were given a teaspoon! We asked for toilet paper, we were given bath towels! For a SERVICE establishment catering mostly to foreigners, none of the staff we met was conversant in English. Worse, they were absolutely uncaring. We did not receive any greeting in the several days we were there. The entire hotel staff is in urgent need of a crash course in English and in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good business customer based Guangdong”
Reviews.Author: Bluedharma
Reviews.Content: The Guangdong Hotel is a business class hotel with bland decoration but with a comfortable environment. The rooms were a good size but we struggled fitting in two large rucksacks so they wouldn’t get in the way. The bed was very, very hard but we were used to fairly hard beds so we were OK. A TV is in the room with many channels with only some in English but a desk and power points are provided for use, with good lighting throughout the room. The hotel is very clean with little clutter. The bathroom was kitted out well with good complimentary gifts including a comb, slippers and a razor. The bath is quite small but the shower was very good and the bathroom was clean. The room also has a safe and a LAN internet connection with a good speed. The service was very good and all the staff were very helpful and friendly. For: - Everything worked and was in good condition - The service was excellent - Access to ADSL internet in room for small fee (GBP8 for 24 hrs) - Good location right in Tsim Sha Tsui for tourist attractions a - MTR is a minute away - We got a business paper delivered each morning even though we hadn’t asked for one. - The bathroom has a heated mirror for your convenience. Against: - Those used to quite soft beds would struggle. - Even when the air condiditoning was off, cold air was being pumped into the room for circulation around the building making the room quite clean - The breakfast isn’t very good (and not included in the rate) but there are a variety of other places to go, including a Delifrance on the corner of Prat Avenue and Chatham Road South.

Reviews.Title: “Great place @ a good price”
Reviews.Author: toothytooth
Reviews.Content: Was there from 20 - 24th Dec. had the normal double room. was surprised at the size wen i got in the room. It was spacious!! location is near to TST MTR Exit A2. It's less than 5 mins walk to the station. There is about 4 clubs/pubs across the hotel. staff service is reasonably "ok". loved the location and the room and that's about it. you can get your breakfast directly opposite the hotel. it the standard teahouse in hong kong which serves good/cheap food. there is also a restaurant on the left of the hotel. just turn left when you are out and you can see the signs of the restaurant. the place starts at 8am for their dim sums. try it! there's 7-Eleven and K-mart along the same street. you have everything here. Granville is just 2 street behind. Glad to choose this hotel over those along Nathan Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: zander341
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Kowloon. It is close to the Star Ferry, subway, shopping, restaurants, the park, etc. The lobby is nice and clean, which is why it is always in the photos. The rooms are quite dirty. The carpets are filthy, and you will need to wear shoes in the room. It amazes me that management allows the rooms to stay like this. The bathroom has a drain that sends the smell of sewage into the bathroom and sometimes into the room. I had to cover my nose. The bed is fine. The staff are not particularly friendly, but they do their job. No greeting, no smiles, just a look that says "What do you want?" We enjoyed being in the heart of Hong Kong, but would NEVER stay in Guangdong Hotel again. Spend a few more bucks and stay someplace decent.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel, But Had Some Problems With The Staff”
Reviews.Author: kimelsey
Reviews.Content: My parents and I recently booked this hotel through Orbitz. We were given a rate of $1080 HKD (about $139 US) for a room for three. By the time we arrived at the hotel, the rate had gone up to $1360. Apparently, we had booked a double room and there was a charge of $250 HKD for an additional bed. (This was not made very clear on the Orbitz website.) We were not pleased with this increase, but kept the room anyway. Six days later when we went to check out, the rate had gone up to $1610. They had double charged us for the extra bed. After about an hour of frustrating negotiations with the manager on duty, we were able to get our rate back down to $1360. If it weren't for this hassle over our room rate, I would say this was a decent hotel. Rooms were small and simple, but clean. Our room needed new carpet, though. The best selling point of this hotel was its location, right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsiu.

Reviews.Title: “OK ..... if you get a deal.”
Reviews.Author: AllanG
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 4 times as I usually get a decent deal online. The rooms are smallish but bigger than the Kowloon Ramada which are tiny. Two restaurants which I wouldn't recommend but being in the heart of Kowloon you can step out the door and find anything you like. There's a Delifrance around the corner on Chatham Road which is great for breakfast and very inexpensive. Nice enough lobby if you need to sit and wait for someone. There's internet access in the business centre but you need to pay a bit for it. Short walk to Nathan Road, subway MTR, Pizza Hut, KFC, McD's. Don't pay top dollar though 'cause it's not luxury. If the Miramar price isn't much more it's a huge step up. Lastly, if you take the Airport Express train from the airport to Kowloon, the shuttle bus doesn't stop at the door. You'll need to get off at the Park Hotel and walk a block or so.

Reviews.Title: “GuangDong Hotel-- A cheerful surprise”
Reviews.Author: jaye_w
Reviews.Content: Hiya, Stayed at this place for 2 nites in July'05. Must admit that the lobby is truly impressive for a 2*/3* hotel. =) Apart from tt, guest rooms were good as well. A reasonable size for a hong kong hotel though bathroom was rather tiny. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. Hotel was also pretty generous with amenities providing bedroom slippers and toothbrushes. On the whole, the hotel still looked rather new (stayed on the 10th floor) and yet they were already refubrishing the lower floors!! Chinese restaurant on the 2nd floor served pretty decent dim sum and the price was reasonable. Location wise-- also pretty convenient. About 5 min walk to Tsimshatsui MTR station. All in all, I had a pleasant stay and would return to the hotel. =)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family in 2 rooms in Guongdong hotel. The hotel rooms were good and neat. This hotel attracts more customers because of the convenient location, customer service and quality of the rooms. I will choose this hotel to stay next time as well. Rating is above average. Try it and you will feel happy. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely come back to guangdong hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay with Guangdong hotel was great. We did not expect it to be as beautiful as it was considering the cheap price we paid for it. The people were nice, very accommodating and fluent in english. The toilet and bath was cool. I never expected to have an elegant bathtub in our room. The place was near shopping areas and restaurants and mtrs as well. We felt safe walking in the streets til dawn. We will surely recommend it to our friends and we will come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “very down-to-earth hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: SeanXM
Reviews.Content: Situated on the Tsimshatsui, very convienemce place for shopping and there are best restraunts in Hongkong. 5 minutes walk to subway station and there are airport shuttle bus just around the quarter. Like other buildings in the area its hotel have over 20 floors. the breakfast was not included and that doesnt make things worse because I found many chinese tea restaruants serving cantonese style breakfast around the corner and that's cheaper than what it would cost in the hotel

HotelInfo.Name: Guang Dong Hotel
